p coil: What exactly is a packaged unit, and how is it different from the standard central AC/heat pump often found in homes? The conventional system is known as a split system because it uses separate indoor and outdoor cabinets. The outdoor cabinet contains the compressor, exhaust fan, and refrigerant coil, and the indoor cabinet houses the blower, refrigerant coil, and connection to the ductwork. With a packaged unit, everything is contained inside a single cabinet located outside, which connects to the building’s ventilation system with return and supply ducts. All heat release and absorption occurs in this one unit, and the conditioned air goes into the supply ducts of the home.

p maintenance: As with any powerful air conditioner or heat pump, a packaged HVAC system must have installation and other services from licensed and certified technicians.
